Description: Spheroidal vase of green serpentine: with a rounded base and two tubular handles. The mouth is surrounded by a flat-topped rim with a rounded outer edge. Interior partly hollowed, leaving thick walls.
Curator's comments: The compressed form and the lack of complete hollowing would suggest a Third Dynasty date, but vases of this type in the Third Dynasty are normally of hard stone. The possibility of the vessel being a modern forgery must be considered.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
